Comic-book adventure, exploring the origins of the Dark Knight, with Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Liam Neeson, Cillian Murphy, Gary Oldman and Katie Holmes.

programme.title: Rosemary's Baby
programme.desc: A couple move into a new apartment, and the husband forms a close friendship with their elderly neighbours. The wife soon becomes pregnant, and starts to suspect her spouse has been seduced into a Satanic cult, who have sinister plans for her baby. Roman Polanski's horror, based on the novel by Ira Levin, and starring Mia Farrow, John Cassavetes, Oscar-winner Ruth Gordon, Sidney Blackmer and Ralph Bellamy.(n)

programme.title: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
programme.desc: An electrical repairman sees a fleet of UFOs and develops an increasing fascination with mountain-shaped forms, driving his wife to despair. Meanwhile, another woman has a similar fixation after her son mysteriously vanishes, and a team of scientists investigates a series of strange events around the world. Eventually, they are all drawn to a mountain where aliens are about to make contact. Steven Spielberg's sci-fi drama, starring Richard Dreyfuss, Francois Truffaut and Teri Garr.(n)

programme.title: Sunshine
programme.desc: Fifty years in the future, Earth faces extinction, so a spacecraft sets out to reignite the sun with an experimental nuclear device. The crew intercepts a message from a previous ship, which disappeared - but the unexpected contact sets off a dangerous chain of events. Danny Boyle's sci-fi thriller, starring Cillian Murphy, Chris Evans, Michelle Yeoh and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: A wealthy old man dying of cancer arranges to have his consciousness transplanted into a younger body. The procedure is a success, but he begins to have suspicions about where his new body came from - only to find that the company behind the process will kill to protect their dark secrets. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Predestination
programme.desc: A time travelling secret agent journeys back and forth through history in search of a bomber who has eluded him throughout his career. His final assignment requires him to finally apprehend the criminal, while also ensuring that his own past takes place as he remembers. Sci-fi thriller based on a short story by Robert Heinlein, starring Ethan Hawke, Sarah Snook and Noah Taylor.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show 2016
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America.(n)

programme.title: The Matrix
programme.desc: A computer hacker discovers the world around him is nothing more than a virtual-reality fantasy created by malevolent living machines. Entering the devastated real world, he joins freedom fighters risking their lives to bring the truth out into the open and liberate the human race. Sci-fi action thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Laurence Fishburne, Carrie-Anne Moss and Hugo Weaving.(n)

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after an absence of several years to find his lost love Lois Lane has moved on with her life. Meanwhile, arch-villain Lex Luthor is out of jail and about to wreak havoc on the world with technology stolen from Superman's home planet of Krypton. Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey.(n)

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: A wealthy old man dying of cancer arranges to have his consciousness transplanted into a younger body. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds and Ben Kingsley.(n)

Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey.(n)

programme.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
programme.desc: A reckless sports writer and his lawyer hit the highways in search of the American Dream, heading for the Nevada gambling capital in a convertible stocked with alcohol and drugs. Comedy, adapted by Terry Gilliam from Hunter S Thompson's book, starring Johnny Depp, Benicio Del Toro, Ellen Barkin, Christina Ricci and Tobey Maguire.

programme.title: A Dirty Shame
programme.desc: A bump on the head transforms a sexually repressed housewife into a sex-addicted exhibitionist - who, finding her husband can no longer fulfil her needs, goes in search of satisfaction in Baltimore's seedy underworld. John Waters' comedy, starring Tracey Ullman, Johnny Knoxville, Selma Blair and Chris Isaak.

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: A war veteran criss-crosses America with his disabled brother in tow as he builds a new career as a renowned prizefighter. However, his ruthless determination to make it to the top drives him to betray the people closest to him. Drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Marilyn Maxwell, Arthur Kennedy, Paul Stewart and Ruth Roman.

programme.title: The Truman Show
programme.desc: A man is unaware his uneventful life is really a sham, and his every move is being secretly filmed and broadcast to the world as part of a 24-hour TV soap. However, a series of unforeseen events leads him to question the nature of his existence. Peter Weir's media satire, starring Jim Carrey, Natascha McElhone, Laura Linney, Noah Emmerich and Ed Harris.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: The laid-back lifestyle of an arrogant New York playboy is shattered when his unstable girlfriend drives off a bridge with him in the car. Although he survives, he struggles to put his life back together in the face of a series of strange events. Cameron Crowe's remake of Spanish thriller Open Your Eyes, starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Kurt Russell, Jason Lee and Penelope Cruz, who also appeared in the original.

programme.title: Partisan
programme.desc: A young boy raised to be an assassin starts to question the ways of his community's charismatic and domineering leader. Drama, with Vincent Cassel, Jeremy Chabriel and Florence Mezzara.

programme.title: The Hustler
programme.desc: An arrogant pool shark challenges a renowned champion player, only to lose the match and end up broke with his confidence shattered. With the aid of a cut-throat manager, he sets about honing his skills for a rematch - but making it to the top could cost him everything. Oscar-winning drama, starring Paul Newman, Jackie Gleason, George C Scott, Piper Laurie, Murray Hamilton and Myron McCormick.

programme.title: Cool Hand Luke
programme.desc: A rebellious small-time crook is sent to a prison in the Deep South, where he becomes a hero in the eyes of his fellow convicts and a thorn in the sides of the warden and the guards by refusing to bow to authority. His defiance escalates when he receives news of his mother's death, and embarks on a series of failed escape attempts. Drama based on Donn Pearce's novel, starring Paul Newman, George Kennedy, JD Cannon and Dennis Hopper.

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: A troubled philosophy professor begins teaching at a small town college, but struggles to find any meaning in his life. He finds some measure of happiness in his friendship with a student, and when they overhear a stranger's conversation, it spurs the tortured academic on to a course of action that changes everything. Woody Allen's drama, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone and Parker Posey.

programme.title: The Truman Show
programme.desc: A man is unaware his uneventful life is really a sham, and his every move is being secretly filmed and broadcast to the world as part of a 24-hour TV soap. However, a series of unforeseen events leads him to question the nature of his existence. Peter Weir's media satire, starring Jim Carrey, Natascha McElhone, Laura Linney, Noah Emmerich and Ed Harris.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: The laid-back lifestyle of an arrogant New York playboy is shattered when his unstable girlfriend drives off a bridge with him in the car. Although he survives, he struggles to put his life back together in the face of a series of strange events. Cameron Crowe's remake of Spanish thriller Open Your Eyes, starring Tom Cruise, Cameron Diaz, Kurt Russell, Jason Lee and Penelope Cruz, who also appeared in the original.

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: An inexperienced financial trader is taken under the wing of a corrupt New York corporate raider, who draws him into the shady world of illegal insider dealing with promises of money and power. But the trainee stockbroker questions the morality of his actions when the consequences of a deal strike close to home. Oliver Stone's Oscar-winning drama, starring Michael Douglas, father and son Martin and Charlie Sheen, Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp.

programme.title: Eyes Wide Shut
programme.desc: A successful doctor is shocked to discover his wife once harboured feelings for another man and resolves to get even by embarking on an affair of his own - only to end up involved with a dangerous exclusive cult. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Sydney Pollack and Marie Richardson.(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: Two middle-aged men embark on a wine-tasting tour in California a week before one of them is due to be married. The groom-to-be is determined to persuade his self-hating, embittered friend to loosen up - while also making it clear he intends to cheat on his fiancee before the week is out. Comedy, starring Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church, Virginia Madsen and Sandra Oh.(n)

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Boxer Rubin `Hurricane' Carter dreams of winning the middleweight world title, only to be wrongfully thrown into prison for the murders of three people in a bar. Nineteen years later, a teenager reads the fighter's autobiography and sets out on a campaign to free him. Fact-based drama, starring Denzel Washington, John Hannah, Deborah Kara Unger, Liev Schreiber and Dan Hedaya.(n)

programme.title: March of the Penguins
programme.desc: Luc Jacquet's Oscar-winning nature documentary follows a colony of emperor penguins on a journey hundreds of miles across the Antarctic ice to reach their breeding grounds, enduring harsh weather conditions and freezing temperatures along the way. Once they have mated, the males stay to guard the eggs while the females return to the sea to gather food. Narrated by Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A detective is sent to Alaska to investigate a murder during a month when the sun does not set. Sleep deprivation starts to take its toll, and he accidentally shoots his partner dead. He tries to cover it up, but the criminal they were hunting has seen everything and blackmails the cop into helping him escape justice. Thriller directed by Christopher Nolan, starring Al Pacino, Robin Williams and Hilary Swank.(n)

programme.title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
programme.desc: An awkward teenager shuns all kinds of social interaction, apart from making films with his best friend. His well-meaning mother urges him to spend time with a girl who has been diagnosed with leukaemia, and they unexpectedly develop a firm friendship. However, his life is changed forever as her condition gets worse. Comedy drama based on Jesse Andrews' novel, starring Thomas Mann, RJ Cyler and Olivia Cooke.(n)

programme.title: Sunset Boulevard
programme.desc: A faded film star from the silent-movie era is fixated with making a comeback. When she meets a struggling screenwriter on the run from debt collectors, she persuades him to write a script that will mark her spectacular return to the screen. However, he takes advantage of the deluded actress, becoming her lover in a relationship where their mutual deceit ends in tragedy. Drama, with Gloria Swanson, William Holden and Eric von Stroheim.(n)

programme.title: Million Dollar Baby
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck boxing coach nurses a grudge because his best fighter has abandoned him for the big time. When a 31-year-old waitress turns up asking him to train her, he refuses outright. However, her persistence wins him round and the pair go on to form a strong professional partnership and successful career. Oscar-winning drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, alongside Hilary Swank, Morgan Freeman and Anthony Mackie.(n)

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, JK Simmons and Paul Reiser.(n)

programme.title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl
programme.desc: An awkward teenager shuns all kinds of social interaction, apart from making films with his best friend. His well-meaning mother urges him to spend time with a girl who has been diagnosed with leukaemia, and they unexpectedly develop a firm friendship. However, his life is changed forever as her condition gets worse. Comedy drama based on Jesse Andrews' novel, starring Thomas Mann, RJ Cyler and Olivia Cooke.(n)

programme.title: Casino
programme.desc: A gambler takes over the running of a Las Vegas casino in the 1970s. His success is threatened by the arrival of an unstable old friend, now a powerful and ambitious mobster, an investigation by the FBI and his own wife's tortured past. Martin Scorsese's crime drama, starring Robert De Niro, Joe Pesci, Sharon Stone and James Woods.(n)

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: Ripley is marooned alone on an all-male prison planet, only to face another of the lethal extraterrestrial creatures - which begins to prey on the inmates. While trying to help them survive, she discovers a terrifying connection between herself and the monster. David Fincher's sci-fi thriller sequel, with Sigourney Weaver and Charles Dance.

programme.title: The Dark Crystal
programme.desc: A survivor of a near-extinct race is given a dangerous quest as his world approaches an astronomical event that will decide its future. He must find a way to restore a broken piece to a magical crystal, which has become a source of dark power for the cruel creatures who wiped out his people. Jim Henson's puppet fantasy, with the voices of Stephen Garlick and Billie Whitelaw.

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes.

programme.title: Stuart Little
programme.desc: An American couple decide their son needs a brother, and plan to adopt another child - but when they get to the orphanage they are greeted by a charming talking mouse named Stuart, who fits the bill perfectly. However, their jealous cat hatches a plot to get rid of the new arrival. Comedy adventure, starring Geena Davis and Hugh Laurie, with the voice of Michael J Fox.

programme.title: Cheaper By the Dozen
programme.desc: A large family moves to a new town, hoping for a fresh start - but nothing goes according to plan, and the unlucky dad ends up in charge of his 12 rowdy children while his wife goes on a promotional book tour. Remake of the 1950 comedy, starring Steve Martin, Bonnie Hunt, Piper Perabo, Tom Welling and Hilary Duff.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Secret agents suspect there is a traitor in their organisation when their latest assignment ends in disaster. The sole survivor is accused of being the mole, forcing him to go on the run to clear his name. However, in the process, he discovers a former Russian spy is selling information about the world's leading undercover operatives. Action thriller based on the 1960s TV series, starring Tom Cruise, Jon Voight and Ving Rhames.

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: An underworld courier lives by a simple code - to never ask what he is transporting. However, when he discovers his latest cargo is alive, his conscience gets the better of him and he faces a dangerous game of cat and mouse with his unknown but powerful employers. Action adventure, starring Jason Statham, Shu Qi, Matt Schulze and Francois Berleand.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane visits Los Angeles to see his family over the Christmas holiday. Stopping off at his wife's place of work, he realises armed men have taken over the building and are holding the corporation's staff to ransom - and only he has the ability to fight back. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman and Bonnie Bedelia.

programme.title: 13 Assassins
programme.desc: A ruthless feudal lord rises to prominence in 19th-century Japan, using his political influence to gain more power, with which he commits atrocities against the populace. A government official realises he is a threat to the entire nation, and recruits 13 samurai warriors to assassinate him. Action adventure, starring Koji Yakusho and Takayuki Yamada. In Japanese.(n)

programme.title: St Trinian's
programme.desc: An anarchic girls' boarding school is threatened with closure, owing to financial difficulties and a strict education minister determined to clean up its bad reputation. The pupils realise their hapless teachers are unable to deal with the crisis, so plan to save the day by dabbling in art theft. Comedy, starring Rupert Everett in a dual role alongside Colin Firth, Russell Brand and Gemma Arterton.(n)

programme.title: The Core
programme.desc: A chain of bizarre and deadly incidents in several countries leads scientists to the conclusion that the Earth's core has stopped spinning. As chaos erupts around the world, experts hatch a plan to halt the destruction and save the human race - but it involves venturing deep below the planet's surface to detonate a nuclear bomb. Sci-fi thriller, starring Aaron Eckhart, Hilary Swank, Stanley Tucci and DJ Qualls.(n)

programme.title: The Tale of the Princess Kaguya
programme.desc: An elderly bamboo cutter finds a tiny princess hidden in a tree, little realising she will grow up to be a beautiful, strong-willed woman. After receiving several marriage proposals, she sets her suitors a variety of challenges in an attempt to learn which of them deserves to win her heart. Animated fantasy, featuring the voice of Chloe Grace Moretz, James Caan and Mary Steenburgen.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt sent to find and destroy the only sample of a deadly man-made virus. However, he faces tough opposition in a former spy-turned-criminal mastermind who has already acquired the cure and now wants the pathogen itself. Director John Woo's action thriller sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Dougray Scott, Thandie Newton and Anthony Hopkins.(n)

programme.title: Die Hard 2
programme.desc: Tough cop John McClane arrives at an airport to pick up his wife, but finds himself plunged into a bloody life-or-death struggle. He must battle terrorists who have seized control of the terminal as part of a campaign to secure the release of a convicted drug baron. Action thriller sequel, starring Bruce Willis, Bonnie Bedelia, William Sadler, Franco Nero and William Atherton.(n)

programme.title: Zero Dark Thirty
programme.desc: A CIA operative joins a team of intelligence and military operatives in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks. She spends the next 10 years searching for information on the whereabouts of Osama bin Laden, ultimately leading to the final raid on the terrorist leader's hideout. Kathryn Bigelow's fact-based drama, starring Jessica Chastain and Mark Strong.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Emily thinks her lost love has come back to her, only to discover it is his son, who is more interested in Erin. Guest starring Jonathan Frakes (Star Trek: The Next Generation).

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben surprises his family when he returns home with a new wife, but soon finds married life is harder than expected.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mr Edwards finds that John prefers reading to hunting, and hopes to modify his adopted son's sensitive behaviour by buying him a rifle. Victor French stars.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura is attracted to a new boy in school, but Nellie is equally keen on him, and plans to ruin their romance.

programme.title: View of Terror
programme.desc: A restaurateur's contented life is thrown into upheaval when she acquires the unwanted attention of an obsessive stalker, who torments her with menacing phone calls. With no clue as to the culprit's identity, she sinks into paranoia, becoming suspicious of everyone she knows. Thriller, starring Shannen Doherty and Michael Francouer.

programme.title: Romance on the Orient Express
programme.desc: An American travelling by train from Venice to Paris bumps into her former lover, and the pair try to understand why their initial romance ended so abruptly. Romantic drama, starring Cheryl Ladd and Stuart Wilson.

programme.title: Complex of Fear
programme.desc: A rookie cop is assigned the tough case of tracking down a killer wreaking havoc among the residents of a housing development - and all the clues point to one of his friends. Thriller, starring Joe Don Baker, Hart Bochner and Chelsea Field.

programme.title: DC 9/11: Time of Crisis
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the aftermath of the September 11 attacks, as people across America attempted to come to terms with the tragedy, focusing on the reaction of President George W Bush and the advice given by his many advisors. Timothy Bottoms, John Cunningham, Andrew Gillies, Penny Johnson and Doug Lennox star.

programme.title: Great Escape 2: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Part one of two. A daring army major returns to Germany to capture the Gestapo officer who ordered the massacre of 50 of his men. Second World War drama, starring Christopher Reeve.

programme.title: Great Escape 2: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Part two of two. A daring army major returns to Germany to capture the Gestapo officer who ordered the massacre of 50 of his men. Second World War drama, starring Christopher Reeve.

programme.title: Remembrance of Love
programme.desc: A widowed concentration camp survivor searches for the woman he loved and lost as a teenager during the Holocaust. Romantic drama, with Pam Dawber and Chana Eden.

programme.title: A Silent Night
programme.desc: A mother and her son are caught in the middle of a Second World War battle and seek shelter in a cabin on Christmas Eve. During the night they are disturbed by three American soldiers and three Germans but she is determined they should keep the peace and enjoy a meal on the holy night. Drama, starring Linda Hamilton, Matthew Harbour and Alan Goulem.

programme.title: One Against the Wind
programme.desc: Biopic of Second World War heroine Mary Lindell, who helped freedom fighters and members of the Allied forces escape the clutches of the Nazis in occupied France. Starring Judy Davis, Sam Neill, Denholm Elliot and Kate Beckinsale.

programme.title: Murder of Innocence
programme.desc: A woman's descent into insanity is witnessed by her confused and alienated husband as he battles the authorities to prove she is a danger to society. Drama, starring Valerie Bertinelli and Stephen Caffrey.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family learn their father's old flame has bought an inn, and rally round to protect him from her. Elizabeth and Cindy open a canteen for the soldiers.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob is rejected by the air force, so joins the army instead. Mary Ellen tries to matchmake Erin with a friend of Curt.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary is chosen to compete in a state maths contest, but learns she cannot afford to go. American Western drama, starring Melissa Sue Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The group goes on a camping trip, but Caroline scratches herself on a piece of baling wire and develops a dangerous infection in her leg. Charles and the other girls are not around to help.(n)

programme.desc: A talented singer-songwriter's love of country music provides her with a means of escaping the clutches of her abusive manager-boyfriend and starting a new life. Drama, starring Dolly Parton, John Terry, Billy Dean and Kimberley Kates.(n)

programme.title: The Christmas Wish
programme.desc: A businessman returns to his hometown to spend the festive season with his grandmother - but when the pair decide to read her dead husband's diary, they make the shocking discovery that he used to spend every Christmas Eve with another woman. Luckily, the revelation leads them to make important discoveries about themselves. Seasonal drama, starring Debbie Reynolds, Neil Patrick Harris and Naomi Watts.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Seduction
programme.desc: A reporter poses as an illegal immigrant and takes a job in the office of a ruthless, seductive lawyer, hoping to expose her corrupt business practices. However, his pursuit of a story is threatened when he becomes infatuated with her. Comedy drama, starring Melanie Griffith and Esai Morales.(n)

programme.title: Stolen Babies
programme.desc: A welfare worker attempts to bring down a woman she believes is running an illegal adoption racket, but finds her efforts constantly thwarted by her adversary's society connections. Fact-based drama, starring Lea Thompson and Mary Tyler Moore.(n)

programme.desc: An abused youngster suffers at the hands of her uncaring grandparents, until she is taken under the wing of an elderly couple - who struggle to help her lay the ghosts of the past to rest. Drama, starring Della Reese, Ossie Davis and Crystal Bernhard.(n)

programme.title: The Unspoken Truth
programme.desc: A woman marries a dangerously volatile man, who one night shoots a man in a fit of rage. He forces her to claim she shot the man by accident, a lie which leaves her facing a life sentence and the possibility of losing her daughter. Fact-based drama, starring Lea Thompson, James Marshall, Patricia Kalember and Robert Englund.(n)

programme.title: For Love of Olivia
programme.desc: A small-town lawyer running for congress is blackmailed into defending a man accused of murder - and to make matters worse, his wife is harbouring a shocking secret. Thriller, starring Louis Gossett Jr, Robert Urich and Lonette McKee.(n)

programme.title: Thicker Than Blood
programme.desc: A man's agonising courtroom battle to gain custody of his son is dealt a crippling blow by the discovery that he isn't the youngster's real father after all. Drama, starring Peter Strauss and Rachel Ticotin.(n)

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
programme.desc: Fact-based drama based on the famous journal of a Jewish youngster forced to hide with her family from occupying Nazis in an Amsterdam attic for two years. Starring Melissa Gilbert, Maximilian Schell and Joan Plowright.(n)

programme.title: Against Her Will: The Carrie Buck Story
programme.desc: A woman with learning disabilities is declared unfit to raise her newborn daughter, but goes to court to fight for custody of the child. Drama, starring Marlee Matlin, Melissa Gilbert and Pat Hingle.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark are hired to look after the children of a movie star who has little time for his family.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark come to the aid of a scriptwriter, who needs help funding a movie.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt learns that a fellow lawman has been corrupted by power, and rules over his town with an iron fist. Nick Nolte guest stars.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: An elderly judge is sent to oversee the trial of a gang of outlaws, and takes desperate steps to ensure that justice is done.

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Monica and Tess try to help a sheriff come to terms with his own past while trying to help his son from committing suicide. Roma Downey and Della Reese star.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy returns his new high-school graduation suit so the family can afford to buy a new cow when Chance dies. Richard Thomas and Ralph Waite star.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A travelling salesman convinces the family to part with their hard-earned cash and buy a small library's worth of novels, essays and poems. But when the books fail to arrive, they soon begin to wonder if he is really a conman.

programme.title: The Haunting of Sarah Hardy
programme.desc: A woman is troubled by witnessing her mother's suicide as a child. As her wedding approaches, she is tormented by strange manifestations and becomes convinced her mother's spirit is haunting her. However, she does not realise someone is plotting to drive her insane. Thriller, starring Sela Ward and Michael Woods.

programme.title: Great Escape 2: The Untold Story
programme.desc: Part one of two. A daring army major returns to Germany to capture the Gestapo officer who ordered the massacre of 50 of his men. Second World War drama, starring Christopher Reeve.

programme.title: No One Could Protect Her
programme.desc: A woman is raped in her own home, but the police seem powerless to apprehend the attacker. As reports of further sexual assaults in her neighbourhood mount up, all seemingly the work of the same man, she resolves to turn detective and bring him to justice herself. Thriller based on a true story, starring Joanna Kerns, Anthony John Denison and Peter MacNeill.

programme.title: Video Voyeur: The Susan Wilson Story
programme.desc: A woman is understandably horrified to discover her apparently kind-hearted neighbour has somehow managed to install state-of-the-art surveillance equipment throughout her home, so he can spy on her and her family. Fact-based drama, starring Angie Harmon, Jamey Sheridan and Dale Midkiff.

programme.title: Family Rescue
programme.desc: A teenager is raped and becomes pregnant by her mother's boyfriend - but to her horror, the court grants him custody of the child. Drama, starring George C Scott, Rachael Leigh Cook, Dom Diamont and Ally Sheedy.

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd.

programme.title: Field Punishment No 1
programme.desc: The New Zealand army forcibly transports 14 conscientious objectors to the European front lines during the First World War. The men struggle to cling to their principles through brutal treatment in a series of military prisons, mental hospitals and battlefields. Fact-based drama, starring Fraser Brown and Byron Coll.

programme.title: Soldier's Girl
programme.desc: A group of soldiers attend a drag show, and one of them ends up forming a relationship with a transsexual performer. One of his friends turns against him and begins stirring up hostility among the ranks. Their drill sergeant resolves to drive out the rumoured gay recruit, but some of the men take a more violent approach. Fact-based drama, starring Troy Garity and Lee Pace.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help an Asian woman whose family have recently arrived in America to protect them from racial prejudice.(n)

programme.desc: An aspiring crime reporter is hired to investigate a series of grisly, unsolved murders stretching from Utah to Seattle, only to discover the killer is one of her closest friends. Fact-based thriller, starring Bill Campbell, Barbara Hershey, Kevin Dunn and Suki Kaiser.(n)

programme.title: The Disappearing Act
programme.desc: A distraught mother turns detective to find out the truth behind her son's disappearance, concerned he may have met with foul play at the hands of his beautiful but volatile girlfriend. Fact-based drama, starring Patty Duke, Kelly Rowan and Robert Floyd.(n)

programme.title: No One Could Protect Her
programme.desc: A woman is raped in her own home, but the police seem powerless to apprehend the attacker. As reports of further sexual assaults in her neighbourhood mount up, all seemingly the work of the same man, she resolves to turn detective and bring him to justice herself. Thriller based on a true story, starring Joanna Kerns, Anthony John Denison and Peter MacNeill.(n)

programme.title: Escape from Terror: The Teresa Stamper Story
programme.desc: A woman falls in love with the man she believes is Mr Right and hastily marries him, but it isn't long before he begins showing his true colours, forcing her to seek shelter at a safe house. Fact-based drama, starring Maria Pitillo, Adam Storke and Brad Dourif.(n)

programme.title: Sacrifices of the Heart

She hopes to resolve the problems that drove them apart and confront a deeply traumatic experience from her childhood. Drama, starring Melissa Gilbert, Ken Howard, Cyril O'Reilly and Lisa Pelikan.(n)

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Fish and Bird. Ray waits to see if Belikov will be released from prison and struggles with the prospect of putting a pimp back out on the street. Meanwhile, Teresa spirals into a postpartum depression; and Mickey tries to persuade the DA that he was the sole architect behind the Minassian massacre

programme.title: The Circus: Inside The Greatest Political Show on Earth

programme.title: Black Snake Moan
programme.desc: In this provocative and affecting character study, Samuel L. Jackson stars as a righteous Tennessee farmer who finds a beaten harlot (Christina Ricci) outside his house and does everything in his power to return her to the path of righteousness and salvation. Ricci is a revelation as the lust-in-the-dust wanton woman with deep-seated psychological problems. Written and directed by Craig Brewer. The film's title comes from the name of a blues standard by Blind Lemon Jefferson

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: A mysterious wanderer looks for dry land after Earth is engulfed by water

programme.title: A.R.C.H.I.E.
programme.desc: A robotic dog goes in search of a family after the lab he belongs to is shut down

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides
programme.desc: Kirsten Dunst (Spiderman) and Josh Hartnett (Black Hawk Down) star in this bittersweet drama, he as the handsome high school jock with brains, she as one of the five Lisbon sisters, all beautiful teenagers. Intertwined with their affair and its sudden ending is the story of how, eventually, all five of the siblings commit suicide, driven by adolescent fears they cannot share while, as a counterpoint, the story is also told from the view of the many boys who admired them from afar. Sofia Coppola (daughter of Francis Ford) captures exactly the angst of growing up in mid-West America in this superbly realised debut film

programme.title: Clouds of Sils Maria

programme.title: Mission: Impossible 2
programme.desc: Special agent Ethan Hunt is plunged into an international crisis. With computer genius Ving Rhames at his side and beautiful thief Thandie Newton on his mind, Hunt races across Australia and Spain on an impossible mission

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Federal Boobie Inspector. Ray visits a Hollywood power player in an attempt to get the Russian mob off his back and unearths a secret Ezra shared in the past. programme.title: Ray Donovan

programme.title: Saw II
programme.desc: Jigsaw, the diabolical criminal who captured the imagination of horror fans in the 2004 hit Saw, returns in this equally bloody sequel. Eric Matthews (Donnie Wahlberg) is a police detective who, after discovering the aftermath of a particularly gruesome murder, is convinced that Jigsaw (Tobin Bell) is up to his ugly tricks again. Matthews' hunch turns out to be correct, but the master criminal proves to be disconcertingly easy to capture. As it happens, Jigsaw is eager to be put behind bars in order to throw the authorities off his trail as he once again punishes people who in his eyes have transgressed the boundaries of acceptable moral behavior. But instead of trapping two people in a filthy dungeon where they must engage in a terrible contest in order to win their freedom, eight people have been locked away by Jigsaw, and they must torture their bodies and minds to achieve the terrible justice Jigsaw seeks. Saw II was written by Leigh Whannell, who also scripted the first film(n)

programme.title: The Railway Man
programme.desc: A British soldier who was held as a prisoner of war by the Japanese during World War II confronts the guard who tortured him in order to find closure to that painful chapter of his life(n)

programme.title: Wonder Boys
programme.desc: Comic drama about a professor suffering from writer's block trying to deal with the pressures of his complex love life and his troubled students' assorted problems. Despite the encouragement of one his admiring female pupils, the professor is obsessed with his current work. He finds release in his friendship with a lonely but gifted student, but the news of his lover's pregnancy further complicates his already difficult life(n)

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey
programme.desc: An Indian teen in France goes to work for his father's culinary adversary in this drama based on the bestselling novel by Richard C. Morais. Put young Hassan Kadam (Manish Dayal) in a kitchen, and he's bound to emerge with a dish that will dazzle. When Hassan's family is forced to move from their native India, his Papa (Om Puri) relocates to a peaceful hamlet in Saint-Antonin-Noble-Val in the south of France. Determined to give his new neighbors a little taste of home, Papa decides to open an Indian restaurant in the village, and names it Maison Mumbai. Meanwhile, across the street at the traditional French restaurant Le Saule Pleureu, uptight proprietor Madame Mallory (Helen Mirren) doesn't exactly welcome the competition. When Madame Mallory ignites a bitter feud that quickly escalates, the only hope for a peaceful resolution lies in Hassan's talent for French haute cuisine, and his growing affections for Mme. Mallory's pretty young sous chef Marguerite (Charlotte Le Bon). Subsequently impressed by Hassan's undeniable culinary talents, Mme. Mallory agrees to become Hassan's mentor, in the process providing the perfect creative environment where his unique fusion cuisine can thrive. Lasse Hallström directs a film produced by Steven Spielberg, Oprah Winfrey, and Juliet Blake(n)

programme.desc: In Spike Lee's brilliant reworking of the cult classic "Ganja and Hess," a doctor develops a voracious thirst for blood after an art curator gives him a cursed artifact. Later, he falls into a treacherous affair with the curator's alluring wife

programme.title: Seventh Moon
programme.desc: A romantic trip to China turns into a lunar nightmare for a pair of happy newlyweds when their taxi driver ditches them in a remote village, and the locals offer them up as sacrifices for the menacing moon creatures that return to Earth annually to replenish their ranks. According to Chinese legend, the dead return to Earth on the seventh month of the lunar year, when the moon glows full in the night sky. America-born Yul (Tim Chiou) and his new wife Melissa (Amy Smart) had just arrived in China to meet Yul's family when their idyllic getaway takes a sudden turn for the worse. When night falls and their tour guide leaves them stranded in a darkened, boarded-up village, Yul and Amy quickly realize that this wasn't a planned stop. Once a year, the lunar creatures return to Earth in search of a sacrifice. Yul and Amy have just been offered up, and now in order to avoid being assimilated into the collective that pursues them through the darkened forest, they will have to survive until the morning light casts the frightful beasts back to the moon for another year

programme.title: Adios, para siempre
programme.desc: A photographer (Gustavo Sanchez Parra) specializing in crime-scene photos runs into a serious problem. Mayra Serbulo. Written and directed by David Guillermo Barba

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Neill Blomkamp (District 9, Elysium) expands on his 2003 short film Tetra Val in this futuristic sci-fi saga written in collaboration with screenwriter Terri Tatchell (who previously worked with Blomkamp on the screenplay for District 9), centering on the story of a police robot named Chappie, who develops the ability to think and feel for himself. As people fight back against the mechanized police force, sinister forces seek to capture Chappie for their nefarious purposes

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Wannabe spaceman Jimmy Hawkins defies his dad and enters a NASA competition just as the International Space Station gets into trouble. With NASA officials out of options, they turn to the bright young star and his friends to save the astronauts trapped 200 miles above Earth

programme.title: Snowpiercer
programme.desc: The Host and Mother director Bong Joon-ho makes his English-language debut with this dystopian sci-fi thriller set in the aftermath of a failed global-warming experiment that ushered in the dawn of a new Ice Age. As a perpetual-motion engine keeps a super-powered locomotive speeding around the planet, the impoverished lower classes occupy the rear cars while the privileged upper classes are pampered in the front. The fragile balance of power between the two begins to shift, however, when an enigmatic message sparks a revolt that cannot be quelled. Luke Evans, Song Kang-ho, Jamie Bell, John Hurt, Tilda Swinton, and Ed Harris star

programme.title: Awaken
programme.desc: A Russian Special Forces soldier must escape from a mysterious island where people are harvested for their organs and continue on her quest to rescue her sister

programme.title: Compound Fracture
programme.desc: A fractured family fights back against the vengeful wraith that's determined to kill them all, and trap their souls for all eternity. Upon learning his aging father's mental health has taken a turn for the worse, Michael Wolffsen (Tyler Mane) packs up the car, and hits the road with his nephew and fiancé in tow. His heavily fortified country home surrounded by acres of land, Michael's father Gary (Muse Watson) has been dabbling in the occult, and his new wife Annabelle is about to walk out on him. Meanwhile, Michael is convinced that his father is suffering from aggressive dementia, and seeks out a facility where he can be treated. Just when it appears that this family has a handle on their problems, however, a malevolent spirit (Derek Mears) appears determined to imprison their souls, and curse them for generations. Now, with their entire bloodline in danger, this family must fight to avoid a fate worse than death

programme.desc: In this riveting, emotionally-charged drama, a petty thief and his cohort, a recently orphaned teen boy, embark on a road trip adventure that involves multiple robberies and results in a strong connection between the two

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A washed-up American actor experiences culture shock while filming a whiskey commercial in Tokyo, but finds solace in his connection with a married 20-something whose successful photographer husband is in the city on an assignment. As the unlikely pair explores Tokyo, they begin to wonder if their sudden friendship might be growing into something more

programme.title: Good Kill
programme.desc: Andrew Niccol's 21st century war drama Good Kill stars Ethan Hawke as Air Force Major Thomas Egan, a talented pilot who spends his days operating a drone over various terrorist threats in the middle east while sitting in a trailer on a base in Las Vegas. Egan hates not being allowed to fly actual planes anymore, and as the CIA begins dictating orders to Egan and his crew, he begins to feel morally disconnected from his job. This leads to more conflict at home with his wife (January Jones), who wishes her husband could focus on their family as much as his military duty. Good Kill screened at the 2014 Toronto International Film Festival

programme.title: Wolves
programme.desc: In this unconventional horror film, a high schooler discovers he's a werewolf after his parents are savagely murdered. He later ends up in a remote mountain town, where he meets others of his kind and fights for the love of a beautiful woman

programme.desc: In a world devoid of all conflict, a teen causes chaos after getting a glimpse of his community's troubled past. Sci-fi drama with Brenton Thwaites. Violence/flashing images. (2014)(94mins)(n)
